name: Software Engineering Discipline
description: End-to-end capabilities required to design, build, test, secure, release, operate, and improve software products and platforms at scale.

children.name: Engineering Strategy and Governance
children.description: Sets direction, guardrails, decision rights, and governance mechanisms for the software engineering discipline.

children.name: Engineering Vision and Strategy
children.description: Defines the multi-year engineering strategy aligned to business, product, risk, and technology objectives.

children.name: Engineering Operating Model Design
children.description: Defines team boundaries, responsibilities, interaction modes, and service ownership model for engineering.

children.name: Policies, Standards, and Guardrails
children.description: Establishes mandatory engineering policies, coding standards, and reusable guardrails.

children.name: Engineering Decision Governance
children.description: Manages engineering decision forums, escalation paths, and documented decision records.

children.name: Risk, Compliance, and Audit Coordination
children.description: Coordinates engineering evidence and actions for regulatory, compliance, and internal audit requirements.

children.name: Engineering Financial Management
children.description: Plans and tracks engineering spend, unit economics, and cost optimization initiatives.

children.name: Product and Requirements Engineering
children.description: Turns business intent into actionable, testable, and traceable requirements for software delivery.

children.name: Problem Framing and Discovery
children.description: Frames customer and business problems, hypotheses, and desired outcomes before implementation.

children.name: Stakeholder and Domain Elicitation
children.description: Elicits requirements, constraints, and priorities from stakeholders and domain experts.

children.name: Requirements Specification
children.description: Documents functional and non-functional requirements in clear, testable formats.

children.name: User Stories and Use Cases
children.description: Defines user stories, use cases, scenarios, and supporting examples for implementation and testing.

children.name: Executable Specifications
children.description: Uses examples, rules, and machine-readable specifications to improve precision and automation.

children.name: Requirement Quality Assurance
children.description: Checks requirement clarity, consistency, completeness, and testability before development.

children.name: Backlog and Scope Management
children.description: Prioritizes, sequences, and manages work items and scope boundaries across releases.

children.name: Acceptance Criteria and Definition of Done
children.description: Defines acceptance conditions and completion rules for work items and releases.

children.name: Requirements Traceability and Change Control
children.description: Maintains traceability across requirements, design, implementation, tests, and production changes.

children.name: Non-Functional Requirements Engineering
children.description: Specifies and validates performance, reliability, security, operability, and compliance requirements.

children.name: Performance and Capacity Requirements
children.description: Defines measurable performance, throughput, and capacity targets.

children.name: Reliability and Availability Requirements
children.description: Defines availability, recovery, and resiliency targets and constraints.

children.name: Operability and Supportability Requirements
children.description: Defines logging, monitoring, alerting, and support readiness requirements.

children.name: Security and Privacy Requirements
children.description: Defines security controls and privacy obligations as engineering requirements.

children.name: Architecture and Design Engineering
children.description: Designs fit-for-purpose software solutions and technical structures that satisfy business and operational requirements.

children.name: Solution Architecture
children.description: Defines solution scope, structure, integration context, and technology choices across systems.

children.name: Context and System Decomposition
children.description: Defines solution context, system boundaries, and major building blocks.

children.name: Technology Selection and Trade-off Analysis
children.description: Evaluates technology options and documents trade-offs and rationale.

children.name: Reference Alignment and Architecture Principles
children.description: Ensures solution architecture aligns to enterprise principles and reference patterns.

children.name: Application and Component Design
children.description: Designs internal modules, responsibilities, boundaries, and interactions within applications.

children.name: Domain Modeling
children.description: Creates shared domain concepts, bounded contexts, data semantics, and business rules models.

children.name: API and Interface Design
children.description: Designs stable interfaces, contracts, versioning strategies, and interaction patterns.

children.name: Contract Modeling and Schema Design
children.description: Designs interface contracts, schemas, and validation rules.

children.name: Versioning and Compatibility Strategy
children.description: Defines versioning policies and backward/forward compatibility expectations.

children.name: API Usability and Consumer Experience
children.description: Designs APIs for discoverability, consistency, and ease of adoption by consumers.

children.name: Data Persistence and State Design
children.description: Designs data stores, schemas, transaction boundaries, and state management patterns.

children.name: Resilience and Failure Mode Design
children.description: Designs for graceful degradation, fault isolation, recovery, and reliability under stress.

children.name: Failure Mode Analysis
children.description: Identifies likely failures, blast radius, and mitigation strategies.

children.name: Graceful Degradation and Fallback Design
children.description: Designs fallback paths and degradation behavior for partial failures.

children.name: Recovery and Idempotency Design
children.description: Designs retries, idempotency, compensation, and recovery-safe behavior.

children.name: Architecture and Design Review
children.description: Runs peer reviews and governance checkpoints for major design and architecture decisions.

children.name: User Experience and Front-End Engineering
children.description: Builds usable, accessible, and consistent user-facing experiences across channels and devices.

children.name: User Research and Journey Analysis
children.description: Collects user insights and journey data to inform product and UI decisions.

children.name: Interaction Design
children.description: Designs user flows, navigation, interaction patterns, and feedback behavior.

children.name: Visual Design and UI Consistency
children.description: Applies visual standards, layout principles, and brand-aligned design patterns.

children.name: Design Systems and Component Libraries
children.description: Maintains reusable UI components, tokens, and usage guidance for product teams.

children.name: Accessibility Engineering
children.description: Builds and verifies accessible interfaces and content against accessibility requirements.

children.name: Usability Testing and Front-End Quality
children.description: Evaluates usability and front-end behavior quality through testing and feedback loops.

children.name: Software Construction and Code Quality
children.description: Implements software changes through maintainable code, sound engineering practices, and effective collaboration.

children.name: Code Implementation
children.description: Implements features, fixes, and technical changes according to designs and standards.

children.name: Refactoring and Codebase Evolution
children.description: Improves code structure, modularity, and readability without changing intended behavior.

children.name: Code Review and Peer Feedback
children.description: Performs structured peer review to improve correctness, maintainability, and shared understanding.

children.name: Review Workflow and Standards
children.description: Defines review expectations, checklists, and service levels for code review.

children.name: Automated Review Assistance
children.description: Uses automated checks and bots to support human review decisions.

children.name: Knowledge Sharing Through Review
children.description: Uses reviews to spread context, standards, and architectural understanding.

children.name: Pairing and Collaborative Programming
children.description: Uses collaborative programming practices to improve delivery quality and knowledge transfer.

children.name: Dependency and Package Management
children.description: Manages internal and external dependencies, versions, updates, and compatibility.

children.name: Configuration and Feature Flag Management
children.description: Manages runtime configuration, environment settings, and feature toggles safely.

children.name: Coding Standards and Static Quality Rules
children.description: Defines and enforces code style, complexity, and static quality thresholds.

children.name: Quality Engineering and Testing
children.description: Provides test strategy, test execution, automation, and quality controls across the delivery lifecycle.

children.name: Test Strategy and Quality Planning
children.description: Defines test approach, levels, responsibilities, and quality objectives for products and releases.

children.name: Unit and Component Testing
children.description: Verifies isolated behavior of functions, classes, and components with automated tests.

children.name: Integration and Contract Testing
children.description: Verifies interactions between components, services, and interfaces including contracts.

children.name: System and End-to-End Testing
children.description: Validates business workflows and system behavior in realistic environments.

children.name: Performance and Scalability Testing
children.description: Assesses response times, throughput, capacity, and behavior under load and stress.

children.name: Test Automation Frameworks and Tooling
children.description: Builds and maintains automation frameworks, utilities, and execution infrastructure.

children.name: Test Data Management
children.description: Provides representative, compliant, and maintainable test data and data provisioning practices.

children.name: Defect Management and Quality Triage
children.description: Records, triages, prioritizes, and resolves defects and quality issues.

children.name: Quality Gates and Release Readiness
children.description: Applies test and quality evidence thresholds before promotion and release.

children.name: Integration and API Engineering
children.description: Enables reliable integration across services, applications, and platforms using APIs, events, and messaging.

children.name: API Lifecycle Management
children.description: Manages API planning, design, versioning, publication, deprecation, and retirement.

children.name: Service-to-Service Integration
children.description: Implements synchronous integrations across internal and external services.

children.name: Event-Driven Integration
children.description: Implements event schemas, producers, consumers, and event processing patterns.

children.name: Messaging and Streaming Engineering
children.description: Builds integrations using queues, topics, streams, and messaging middleware.

children.name: API Security and Traffic Management
children.description: Applies authentication, authorization, rate limiting, and API gateway controls.

children.name: Integration Observability and Support
children.description: Monitors integration health, failures, retries, and operational support processes.

children.name: Data and State Engineering within Applications
children.description: Designs and operates application-level data, state, caching, and migration mechanisms.

children.name: Data Access Layer Engineering
children.description: Implements data access abstractions, repositories, query patterns, and ORM usage.

children.name: Transactional Consistency Management
children.description: Defines transaction boundaries, consistency strategies, and concurrency handling.

children.name: Schema Design and Migration Management
children.description: Designs schemas and manages controlled database schema and data migrations.

children.name: Caching and State Optimization
children.description: Implements caching, session/state handling, and performance-oriented state strategies.

children.name: Search and Index Integration
children.description: Implements search indexing, query tuning, and search integration patterns.

children.name: Application Data Privacy and Retention Controls
children.description: Implements privacy-aware data handling, minimization, masking, and retention behavior in applications.

children.name: Application Data Quality Controls
children.description: Implements validation, reconciliation, and integrity checks for application-managed data.

children.name: Build, Packaging, and Release Engineering
children.description: Automates build, packaging, CI/CD pipelines, release coordination, and deployment promotion controls.

children.name: Source Control and Branching Workflows
children.description: Defines and operates branching, trunk-based or hybrid workflows, and merge controls.

children.name: Build Automation
children.description: Automates compilation, linting, testing, and build steps across repositories.

children.name: Artifact Packaging and Repository Management
children.description: Packages and stores build artifacts, containers, and release bundles securely.

children.name: Continuous Integration Pipelines
children.description: Runs automated validation pipelines for code changes and pull requests.

children.name: Pipeline Orchestration and Templates
children.description: Defines reusable pipeline patterns and execution flows.

children.name: Build Validation and Quality Checks
children.description: Runs automated tests, linting, scans, and policy checks in CI.

children.name: Pipeline Performance and Reliability
children.description: Monitors CI stability, queue time, and execution performance.

children.name: Release Orchestration and Coordination
children.description: Coordinates releases, freeze windows, approvals, and multi-team rollout execution.

children.name: Environment Promotion and Deployment Automation
children.description: Promotes builds across environments using automated and controlled deployment flows.

children.name: Deployment Strategies
children.description: Implements blue-green, canary, rolling, or feature-flag-based deployment strategies.

children.name: Environment Configuration Promotion
children.description: Promotes configuration and secrets changes safely across environments.

children.name: Deployment Verification and Smoke Tests
children.description: Runs post-deploy checks to validate deployment success and service health.

children.name: Rollback, Roll-Forward, and Recovery Procedures
children.description: Provides standardized rollback or roll-forward mechanisms when releases fail.

children.name: Versioning, Change Logs, and Release Notes
children.description: Maintains versioning conventions, change summaries, and release communication artifacts.

children.name: Platform Engineering and Developer Experience
children.description: Provides internal platforms, self-service tooling, and developer workflows that improve engineering throughput and reliability.

children.name: Internal Developer Platform Strategy
children.description: Defines platform products, service boundaries, and platform engineering roadmap priorities.

children.name: Platform Product Management
children.description: Defines platform value propositions, roadmaps, and service levels.

children.name: Platform Service Portfolio Management
children.description: Manages the set of platform capabilities offered to engineering teams.

children.name: Platform Governance and Adoption Model
children.description: Defines platform standards, adoption expectations, and exceptions.

children.name: Self-Service Environment Provisioning
children.description: Provides self-service provisioning for development, test, and ephemeral environments.

children.name: Local Development Environment Tooling
children.description: Standardizes local setup, bootstrapping, and reproducible development environments.

children.name: Golden Paths and Project Scaffolding
children.description: Provides templates, starter kits, and paved-road engineering workflows.

children.name: Reference Templates and Starters
children.description: Provides vetted starter templates and service blueprints.

children.name: Policy-as-Code Guardrails in Templates
children.description: Embeds baseline policy checks and configurations into scaffolds.

children.name: Template Lifecycle and Version Management
children.description: Maintains template versions, deprecations, and migration guidance.

children.name: Developer Portals and Service Catalogs
children.description: Provides service catalog, ownership metadata, and documentation discovery for engineers.

children.name: Engineering Productivity Tooling
children.description: Provides integrated tools and automations for coding, testing, debugging, and collaboration.

children.name: IDE and Editor Tooling Enablement
children.description: Provides approved editor integrations, extensions, and defaults.

children.name: Workflow Automation and CLI Tooling
children.description: Provides CLIs and automations for routine engineering workflows.

children.name: Productivity Data and Tooling Telemetry
children.description: Measures tooling usage, friction points, and productivity signals.

children.name: Inner Source and Reuse Enablement
children.description: Enables discoverability, reuse, and contribution to shared internal software assets.

children.name: Developer Support and Enablement Services
children.description: Operates support channels, onboarding help, and issue resolution for engineering platforms.

children.name: Operations and Reliability Engineering
children.description: Runs software services safely in production with strong observability, reliability, and incident response capabilities.

children.name: Production Service Operations
children.description: Operates and administers production services, jobs, and runtime processes.

children.name: Site Reliability Engineering Practices
children.description: Applies SRE principles including reliability budgets, automation, and service objectives.

children.name: Service Level Objectives and Error Budgets
children.description: Defines and operates SLOs, SLIs, and error budget policies.

children.name: Toil Reduction and Reliability Automation
children.description: Identifies and automates repetitive operational toil.

children.name: Reliability Review and Risk Management
children.description: Reviews reliability risks and planned changes against service objectives.

children.name: Monitoring, Logging, and Tracing
children.description: Implements telemetry collection, observability pipelines, dashboards, and diagnostics.

children.name: Telemetry Instrumentation Standards
children.description: Defines instrumentation patterns and semantic conventions.

children.name: Observability Data Pipeline Management
children.description: Operates telemetry ingestion, storage, routing, and retention pipelines.

children.name: Dashboards, Alerts, and Diagnostics
children.description: Maintains actionable dashboards, alerts, and diagnostic workflows.

children.name: Incident Detection and Response
children.description: Detects, triages, responds to, and communicates operational incidents.

children.name: On-Call and Escalation Management
children.description: Defines on-call rotations, escalation paths, and response responsibilities.

children.name: Incident Command and Coordination
children.description: Coordinates triage, mitigation, communications, and decision making during incidents.

children.name: Incident Communications
children.description: Provides clear internal and external updates during service disruptions.

children.name: Problem Management and Root Cause Analysis
children.description: Identifies systemic causes of incidents and coordinates corrective actions.

children.name: Capacity, Performance, and Cost Optimization
children.description: Optimizes runtime capacity, performance efficiency, and operating costs.

children.name: Availability, Continuity, and Disaster Recovery
children.description: Designs and validates availability targets, backups, failover, and recovery processes.

children.name: Backup and Restore Engineering
children.description: Implements and validates backup and restore mechanisms.

children.name: Failover and Recovery Testing
children.description: Tests failover procedures and validates recovery objectives.

children.name: Business Continuity Integration
children.description: Coordinates software recovery practices with broader continuity arrangements.

children.name: Runbook and Operations Automation
children.description: Automates repetitive operational tasks using scripts, workflows, and orchestration.

children.name: Operational Script and Workflow Automation
children.description: Implements scripts and workflows for repeatable operations tasks.

children.name: Auto-Remediation Patterns
children.description: Applies safe automated remediation for known and bounded failure modes.

children.name: Automation Safety Controls
children.description: Defines approvals, guardrails, and rollback for operations automation.

children.name: Security Engineering and Secure SDLC
children.description: Embeds security into software engineering through secure design, build, test, release, and runtime practices.

children.name: Threat Modeling and Security Design Review
children.description: Identifies threats and validates mitigations during design and architecture stages.

children.name: Threat Identification and Abuse Cases
children.description: Identifies threats, abuse cases, and attacker paths for proposed designs.

children.name: Mitigation Design and Security Controls
children.description: Defines mitigations and compensating controls for identified threats.

children.name: Security Review Sign-off and Exceptions
children.description: Records review outcomes, exceptions, and remediation commitments.

children.name: Secure Coding Practices
children.description: Applies secure coding standards and security-focused peer review during implementation.

children.name: Secure Coding Standards and Checklists
children.description: Defines language-specific secure coding standards and checklists.

children.name: Security-Focused Code Review
children.description: Integrates security concerns into code review workflows.

children.name: Developer Security Training Integration
children.description: Embeds secure coding training into engineering workflows and onboarding.

children.name: Application Security Testing
children.description: Performs SAST, DAST, IAST, and manual testing for application vulnerabilities.

children.name: Static Application Security Testing
children.description: Runs and tunes static analysis for source and binaries.

children.name: Dynamic and Interactive Security Testing
children.description: Performs dynamic testing and runtime-assisted application security testing.

children.name: Manual Security Review and Penetration Testing
children.description: Performs expert-driven testing for high-risk applications and changes.

children.name: Software Composition and Dependency Security
children.description: Manages open-source dependency risk, vulnerability exposure, and update remediation.

children.name: Dependency Inventory and SBOM Management
children.description: Maintains component inventories and software bills of materials.

children.name: Dependency Vulnerability Monitoring
children.description: Monitors dependency vulnerabilities and exposure continuously.

children.name: Secure Dependency Update Automation
children.description: Automates dependency update proposals with testing and policy controls.

children.name: Secrets and Key Management in Delivery Pipelines
children.description: Protects secrets, keys, and credentials used by developers, applications, and automation.

children.name: Secret Storage and Access Patterns
children.description: Defines approved secret storage and access mechanisms.

children.name: Secret Rotation and Revocation
children.description: Rotates and revokes secrets on schedule and on demand.

children.name: Secret Scanning and Exposure Response
children.description: Detects exposed secrets and coordinates containment and rotation.

children.name: Infrastructure and Configuration Security Validation
children.description: Validates infrastructure-as-code and configuration against security baselines.

children.name: Identity, Access, and Privileged Engineering Controls
children.description: Controls developer and pipeline access, privileges, and separation of duties.

children.name: Software Supply Chain Security
children.description: Protects build provenance, artifact integrity, and release chain trust.

children.name: Build Provenance and Attestation
children.description: Generates and verifies provenance, attestations, and traceability for builds.

children.name: Artifact Integrity and Signing
children.description: Applies signing and verification to artifacts, packages, and containers.

children.name: Trusted Build Environments
children.description: Hardens and controls build environments and runners.

children.name: Vulnerability Management and Remediation
children.description: Tracks, prioritizes, and remediates vulnerabilities within SLA and risk appetite.

children.name: Vulnerability Intake and Triage
children.description: Ingests findings and triages by severity, exploitability, and asset criticality.

children.name: Remediation Planning and SLA Tracking
children.description: Plans remediation, tracks SLAs, and manages risk exceptions.

children.name: Verification and Closure
children.description: Verifies fixes and closes findings with evidence.

children.name: Security Incident Support and Forensics Readiness
children.description: Supports investigation, containment, and evidence handling for software-related security incidents.

children.name: Documentation and Knowledge Management
children.description: Captures and maintains engineering knowledge, operational guidance, and decision context for reuse and continuity.

children.name: Code and Inline Documentation
children.description: Maintains code comments, annotations, and code-level usage documentation where needed.

children.name: Technical Design and Architecture Documentation
children.description: Documents architecture, design rationale, and engineering decisions for traceability.

children.name: API Documentation and Developer Guides
children.description: Publishes accurate API references, examples, and integration guidance.

children.name: Runbooks, Playbooks, and Support Documentation
children.description: Maintains operational instructions for incidents, routine tasks, and service support.

children.name: Knowledge Base Curation and Information Architecture
children.description: Structures and curates engineering knowledge repositories for findability and reuse.

children.name: Postmortems and Lessons Learned Capture
children.description: Captures and disseminates lessons learned from incidents, delivery issues, and improvements.

children.name: Engineering Management and Ways of Working
children.description: Coordinates delivery, teams, and collaboration models that enable predictable and sustainable software engineering outcomes.

children.name: Delivery Planning and Estimation
children.description: Plans releases and iterations using estimation and forecasting approaches appropriate to context.

children.name: Flow Management and Work in Progress Control
children.description: Manages workflow, bottlenecks, and WIP to improve delivery predictability and throughput.

children.name: Team Topologies and Interface Management
children.description: Designs team interactions and ownership boundaries to reduce coordination overhead.

children.name: Cross-Team Dependency Management
children.description: Identifies and coordinates dependencies, sequencing, and integration milestones across teams.

children.name: Stakeholder Communication and Reporting
children.description: Communicates engineering plans, risks, status, and outcomes to stakeholders.

children.name: Change Enablement and Release Governance
children.description: Coordinates change approvals, change windows, and operational readiness with control functions.

children.name: Third-Party Engineering and Vendor Coordination
children.description: Coordinates engineering work with vendors, partners, and outsourced delivery providers.

children.name: Distributed Collaboration Practices
children.description: Enables effective remote and distributed engineering collaboration across locations and time zones.

children.name: Talent and Capability Development
children.description: Builds the workforce capabilities, roles, and learning systems needed for software engineering excellence.

children.name: Engineering Role and Skill Frameworks
children.description: Defines roles, skill expectations, and competency progression for engineering disciplines.

children.name: Engineering Hiring and Selection
children.description: Attracts and assesses engineering talent using structured hiring practices.

children.name: Onboarding and Time-to-Productivity
children.description: Onboards engineers effectively and shortens time to safe, productive contribution.

children.name: Skills Assessment and Gap Analysis
children.description: Assesses current skills and identifies gaps against strategy and platform needs.

children.name: Training, Learning Paths, and Certification
children.description: Provides learning content, structured training paths, and optional certifications.

children.name: Coaching, Mentoring, and Technical Leadership
children.description: Develops engineers through mentoring, coaching, and technical leadership practices.

children.name: Career Growth and Performance Development
children.description: Supports fair progression, feedback, and growth planning for engineering staff.

children.name: Communities of Practice and Guilds
children.description: Facilitates communities that share patterns, standards, and lessons across teams.

children.name: Metrics, Improvement, and Innovation Management
children.description: Measures engineering effectiveness and quality, drives continuous improvement, and enables controlled innovation.

children.name: Engineering Metrics Framework
children.description: Defines engineering metrics, owners, definitions, and reporting cadences.

children.name: Metric Definitions and Data Contracts
children.description: Defines metrics, data sources, calculations, and ownership.

children.name: Metrics Governance and Review Cadence
children.description: Runs governance for metric quality, interpretation, and review usage.

children.name: Scorecards and Executive Reporting
children.description: Publishes scorecards tailored to teams, leaders, and control functions.

children.name: Delivery Flow and DORA Metrics
children.description: Measures software delivery performance and flow efficiency using standard and context-specific metrics.

children.name: Flow Measurement Instrumentation
children.description: Instruments toolchain events needed to calculate delivery flow metrics.

children.name: Benchmarking and Contextual Interpretation
children.description: Interprets delivery metrics with context and benchmark comparisons.

children.name: Improvement Action Planning from Flow Data
children.description: Uses flow data to prioritize and track improvements.

children.name: Quality and Defect Trend Analytics
children.description: Analyzes quality trends, defect patterns, and predictive quality signals.

children.name: Reliability and Service Health Analytics
children.description: Measures reliability outcomes and operational health trends for services.

children.name: Continuous Improvement and Kaizen Execution
children.description: Runs improvement backlogs and experiments to address recurring pain points.

children.name: Retrospective and Learning Mechanisms
children.description: Runs retrospectives and learning loops that produce actionable improvements.

children.name: Improvement Backlog Management
children.description: Maintains and prioritizes improvement actions with owners and due dates.

children.name: Benefit Tracking for Improvements
children.description: Measures impact of completed improvements against target outcomes.

children.name: Technical Debt Identification and Prioritization
children.description: Identifies, quantifies, and prioritizes technical debt remediation.

children.name: Debt Discovery and Classification
children.description: Identifies debt items and classifies by risk, cost, and impact.

children.name: Debt Valuation and Business Framing
children.description: Frames debt in business terms including risk and delivery impact.

children.name: Debt Remediation Portfolio Planning
children.description: Plans remediation work within capacity and strategic priorities.

children.name: Value Stream Mapping and Process Diagnostics
children.description: Maps delivery value streams and diagnoses bottlenecks and waste.

children.name: Engineering Innovation and Experimentation
children.description: Evaluates and pilots new engineering practices, tools, and architectural approaches.

children.name: AI-Assisted Engineering and Automation
children.description: Applies AI tools and agentic workflows safely and effectively across the software engineering lifecycle.

children.name: AI Tool Strategy and Governance for Engineering
children.description: Defines approved AI use cases, guardrails, risk controls, and adoption strategy for engineering.

children.name: Approved Use Case Catalog
children.description: Defines approved and prohibited AI engineering use cases.

children.name: AI Risk Controls and Policy Mapping
children.description: Maps AI tool usage to security, privacy, compliance, and IP controls.

children.name: Tool Evaluation and Approval Workflow
children.description: Evaluates and approves AI tools and models for engineering use.

children.name: AI-Assisted Requirements and Design Support
children.description: Uses AI to accelerate requirement drafting, design exploration, and specification quality.

children.name: AI-Assisted Coding and Refactoring
children.description: Uses coding assistants and agents to generate, transform, and improve code safely.

children.name: Prompt and Spec Patterns for Coding
children.description: Defines effective prompting/specification patterns for coding assistants and agents.

children.name: Human-in-the-Loop Review for AI Changes
children.description: Applies review and validation controls for AI-generated code changes.

children.name: AI Refactoring and Modernization Workflows
children.description: Uses AI to accelerate safe refactoring and legacy modernization.

children.name: AI-Assisted Testing and Quality Support
children.description: Uses AI to generate tests, identify edge cases, and support defect triage.

children.name: AI-Assisted Code Review and Documentation
children.description: Uses AI to support review summaries, documentation generation, and change explanations.

children.name: Agentic Workflow Orchestration in Engineering
children.description: Designs and operates multi-step or multi-agent workflows for engineering tasks.

children.name: Task Decomposition and Planning for Agents
children.description: Structures engineering tasks into agent-executable steps and checkpoints.

children.name: Tool Integration and Execution Control
children.description: Integrates tools and controls execution permissions for engineering agents.

children.name: Agent Output Verification and Recovery Loops
children.description: Verifies agent outputs and applies retries or fallback workflows.

children.name: Evaluation and Benchmarking of Engineering AI Assistants
children.description: Evaluates AI assistant performance, safety, and usefulness in engineering contexts.

children.name: Task Suite and Scenario Design
children.description: Designs representative engineering tasks for evaluating assistant performance.

children.name: Quality, Safety, and Reliability Evaluation
children.description: Measures correctness, safety, and reliability of assistant outputs.

children.name: Adoption Readiness and Rollout Criteria
children.description: Defines rollout criteria based on evaluation evidence and risks.

children.name: AI Adoption Enablement and Productivity Measurement
children.description: Enables engineering teams to adopt AI tools and measures impact responsibly.

children.name: Open Source and Third-Party Software Management
children.description: Manages software dependencies, open-source use, licenses, and third-party engineering risk within delivery workflows.

children.name: Open Source Consumption Governance
children.description: Defines approved usage patterns, repositories, and controls for open-source software consumption.

children.name: Approved Source and Repository Controls
children.description: Defines trusted package sources and repository usage controls.

children.name: Open Source Intake Review
children.description: Reviews new OSS components for suitability and risk before adoption.

children.name: Exception and Waiver Management
children.description: Manages exceptions to OSS consumption policies with documented risk acceptance.

children.name: License Compliance and Obligation Management
children.description: Identifies and manages license obligations, notices, and restrictions.

children.name: License Detection and Classification
children.description: Identifies and classifies component licenses accurately.

children.name: Obligation Tracking and Notice Generation
children.description: Tracks obligations and generates notices and attributions.

children.name: Policy Enforcement for Restricted Licenses
children.description: Enforces policies for copyleft or otherwise restricted licenses.

children.name: Third-Party Component Risk Assessment
children.description: Assesses operational, security, support, and legal risks of third-party components.

children.name: Dependency Lifecycle and Upgrade Management
children.description: Plans dependency upgrades, compatibility testing, and deprecation handling.

children.name: Third-Party Service and SDK Integration Governance
children.description: Governs integration of external services, SDKs, and APIs into products.

children.name: Open Source Contribution and Inner/Outer Source Policy
children.description: Manages contribution approvals, contribution workflows, and upstream collaboration practices.

children.name: Commercial Engineering Tool Vendor Management
children.description: Selects and manages engineering tooling vendors, contracts, and operational fit.

children.name: Service Lifecycle Transition and Support Readiness
children.description: Ensures software services transition safely into operation with support readiness, handover quality, and lifecycle closure.

children.name: Operational Readiness Review
children.description: Validates that services meet operational prerequisites before go-live or major changes.

children.name: Readiness Criteria Definition
children.description: Defines go-live readiness criteria across engineering, support, and control functions.

children.name: Evidence Collection and Review Execution
children.description: Collects readiness evidence and runs review checkpoints.

children.name: Go-Live Conditions and Follow-up Actions
children.description: Records go-live conditions, risks, and post-launch follow-up actions.

children.name: Support Model Definition and Handover
children.description: Defines support tiers, responsibilities, and handover materials between build and run teams.

children.name: Support Responsibility Matrix
children.description: Defines support roles, responsibilities, and escalation paths.

children.name: Handover Artifact Preparation
children.description: Prepares runbooks, architecture summaries, and known issue documentation.

children.name: Hypercare and Early Life Support
children.description: Provides enhanced support during the early post-release period.

children.name: Service Catalog and Ownership Registration
children.description: Registers services, owners, contacts, and support metadata in service inventory systems.

children.name: Service Metadata Standards
children.description: Defines required service metadata and ownership attributes.

children.name: Ownership and Contact Maintenance
children.description: Maintains current owner and support contact information.

children.name: Catalog Integration and Discovery
children.description: Integrates service metadata into discovery and support workflows.

children.name: Lifecycle Maintenance and End-of-Life Planning
children.description: Plans maintenance windows, version support timelines, and retirement or replacement paths.

children.name: Customer/Business Release Communication
children.description: Communicates release impacts, known issues, and support expectations to users and stakeholders.
